alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued April 22 at 9:11PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY HEALTH ADVISORY FOR WILDFIRE SMOKE FROM 200 PM FRIDAY UNTIL 900 AM SATURDAY... The Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment has issued the following... WHAT...Air Quality Health Advisory for Wildfire Smoke. WHERE...portions of northern Prowers County and eastern portions of Kiowa and Cheyenne Counties. Locations include, but are not limited to, Brandon, Sheridan Lake, Stuart, and Cheyenne Wells. WHEN...200 PM Friday April 22 to 900 AM Saturday April 23 IMPACTS...Smoke from wildfires in northern Prowers County and eastern Kiowa County will affect the advisory area through Friday evening and into Saturday morning. HEALTH INFORMATION...Public Health Recommendations: If smoke is thick or becomes thick in your neighborhood you may want to remain indoors. This is especially true for those with heart disease, respiratory illnesses, the very young, and the elderly. Consider limiting outdoor activity when moderate to heavy smoke is present. Consider relocating temporarily if smoke is present indoors and is making you ill. If visibility is less than 5 miles in smoke in your neighborhood, smoke has reached levels that are unhealthy.
